trans-unit.source: Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine

seg-source.mrk: Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine

trans-unit.source: Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine

seg-source.mrk: Installing the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine

trans-unit.source: You only need to install and configure the Script Engine if you purchased a version of Workflow Accelerator which allows you to use JavaScript tasks.

seg-source.mrk: You only need to install and configure the Script Engine if you purchased a version of Workflow Accelerator which allows you to use JavaScript tasks.

trans-unit.source: The Workflow Accelerator Script Engine uses Node.js to execute JavaScript tasks within a workflow and an embedded HTTP server to communicate with the Workflow Accelerator web application. You can install the Script Engine on either the same machine as the Workflow Accelerator web application or on a separate machine. However, if you use a separate machine to run the script engine, you have to make sure the web application can connect over HTTP to the configured port of the script engine and vice versa. In order to install the script engine, follow these instructions:

seg-source.mrk: The Workflow Accelerator Script Engine uses Node.js to execute JavaScript tasks within a workflow and an embedded HTTP server to communicate with the Workflow Accelerator web application.
You can install the Script Engine on either the same machine as the Workflow Accelerator web application or on a separate machine.
However, if you use a separate machine to run the script engine, you have to make sure the web application can connect over HTTP to the configured port of the script engine and vice versa.
In order to install the script engine, follow these instructions:

trans-unit.source:
Create new local directory for the script engine,
e.g. C:\Program Files\Script Engine or /var/lib/script-engine.
  • We will refer to this directory as $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME.

seg-source.mrk: Create new local directory for the script engine, <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" />
e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">C:\Program Files\Script Engine</kbd> or <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">/var/lib/script-engine</kbd>.
<ul xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><li> We will refer to this directory as <kbd>$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME</kbd>.

trans-unit.source:
Copy the content of the directory $WORKFLOW_HOME/script-engine/ to your newly created directory.
  • You should find the file server.js directly within your directory: $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/server.js.

seg-source.mrk: Copy the content of the directory <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$WORKFLOW_HOME/script-engine/</kbd> to your newly created directory.
<ul xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><li> You should find the file <kbd>server.js</kbd> directly within your directory: <kbd>$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/server.js</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: Next, edit two configuration files.

seg-source.mrk: Next, edit two configuration files.

trans-unit.source:
in the Script Engine configuration file $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/configuration.onpremise.js edit the values for the port, the log files and the Workflow Accelerator URL.
  • Ensure that the port for the script engine is not used by any other application.

seg-source.mrk: in the Script Engine configuration file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/configuration.onpremise.js</kbd> edit the values for the port, the log files and the Workflow Accelerator URL.
<ul xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><li> Ensure that the port for the script engine is not used by any other application.

trans-unit.source: port

seg-source.mrk: port

trans-unit.source: Defines the port the script engine will bind to and listen for incoming HTTP requests.

seg-source.mrk: Defines the port the script engine will bind to and listen for incoming HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: log file

seg-source.mrk: log file

trans-unit.source: Defines the location and name of the script engine log file. You can an absolute or relative path. By default, the log files are stored in the same directory as the script engine.

seg-source.mrk: Defines the location and name of the script engine log file.
You can an absolute or relative path.
By default, the log files are stored in the same directory as the script engine.

trans-unit.source: log errorFile

seg-source.mrk: log errorFile

trans-unit.source: Defines the location and name of the script engine error log file.

seg-source.mrk: Defines the location and name of the script engine error log file.

trans-unit.source: workflowUrl

seg-source.mrk: workflowUrl

trans-unit.source: Defines the URL of the Workflow Accelerator system (including port), e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8080</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: Defines the URL of the Workflow Accelerator system (including port), e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8080</kbd>

trans-unit.source: In the the Workflow Accelerator configuration file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/effektif-onpremise.properties</kbd>, add the URL of the script engine.

seg-source.mrk: In the the Workflow Accelerator configuration file <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/ROOT/WEB-INF/classes/effektif-onpremise.properties</kbd>, add the URL of the script engine.

trans-unit.source: This URL is not part of the configuration file template, you need to add the complete property.

seg-source.mrk: This URL is not part of the configuration file template, you need to add the complete property.

trans-unit.source: If you run the script engine on the same machine as the web application and use the default port the URL will be <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>.

seg-source.mrk: If you run the script engine on the same machine as the web application and use the default port the URL will be <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: effektif.javascript.server.url

seg-source.mrk: effektif.javascript.server.url

trans-unit.source: (Optional) The URL of the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: (Optional) The URL of the Workflow Accelerator Script Engine, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>

trans-unit.source: After the successful set-up you can start the script engine by opening the <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" /><kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME></kbd> directory on a command line and executing the following command:

seg-source.mrk: After the successful set-up you can start the script engine by opening the <br xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" /><kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME></kbd> directory on a command line and executing the following command:

trans-unit.source: Wrapping the Script Engine into a service

seg-source.mrk: Wrapping the Script Engine into a service

trans-unit.source: The script engine can be executed as shown above by running the command on a command line. However, it might be useful for production systems to run the script engine as a service or daemon. The following sub sections describe one possibility for each supported operating system which can be used the accomplish this goal. Note that Signavio offers no support for any third-party tools. Use them at your own discretion.

seg-source.mrk: The script engine can be executed as shown above by running the command on a command line.
However, it might be useful for production systems to run the script engine as a service or daemon.
The following sub sections describe one possibility for each supported operating system which can be used the accomplish this goal.
Note that Signavio offers no support for any third-party tools.
Use them at your own discretion.

trans-unit.source: Windows

seg-source.mrk: Windows

trans-unit.source: For Windows, there are several software tools which allow you to wrap a script into a service and monitor the execution. The Non-Sucking Service Manager (NSSM) is such a free tool which allows you to wrap any executable into a Windows service.

seg-source.mrk: For Windows, there are several software tools which allow you to wrap a script into a service and monitor the execution.
The Non-Sucking Service Manager (NSSM) is such a free tool which allows you to wrap any executable into a Windows service.

trans-unit.source: Download NSSM from http://nssm.cc/download

seg-source.mrk: Download NSSM from http://nssm.cc/download

trans-unit.source: Create a new local installation directory for NSSM, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">C:\Program Files\NSSM</kbd>.

seg-source.mrk: Create a new local installation directory for NSSM, e.g. <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">C:\Program Files\NSSM</kbd>.

trans-unit.source: Unzip the downloaded file and copy either the 64-bit <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">win64\nssm.exe</kbd> or the 32-bit <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">win32\nssm.exe</kbd> file to your new local directory.

seg-source.mrk: Unzip the downloaded file and copy either the 64-bit <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">win64\nssm.exe</kbd> or the 32-bit <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">win32\nssm.exe</kbd> file to your new local directory.

trans-unit.source:
Add the installation directory of NSSM to the environment variable PATH in the Windows system settings.
  • This is necessary to use the nssm executable on the command line without an absolute path.

seg-source.mrk: Add the installation directory of NSSM to the environment variable <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">PATH</kbd> in the Windows system settings.
<ul xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"><li> This is necessary to use the <kbd>nssm</kbd> executable on the command line without an absolute path.

trans-unit.source: Open the command line <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">cmd</kbd> with administrative privileges.

seg-source.mrk: Open the command line <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">cmd</kbd> with administrative privileges.

trans-unit.source: Execute

seg-source.mrk: Execute

trans-unit.source: The NSSM configuration dialog opens

seg-source.mrk: The NSSM configuration dialog opens

trans-unit.source:
In the Application tab fill in the following information:
Path the path to the Node.js .exe file, e.g.
C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe
Startup directory the value of $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME, e.g. C:\Program Files\Script Engine.
Arguments the exact value server.js

seg-source.mrk:
In the Application tab fill in the following information:
Path the path to the Node.js .exe file, e.g.
C:\Program Files\nodejs\node.exe
Startup directory the value of $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME, e.g. C:\Program Files\Script Engine.
Arguments the exact value server.js

trans-unit.source: In the Details tab fill in the following information:

seg-source.mrk: In the Details tab fill in the following information:

trans-unit.source: Display name

seg-source.mrk: Display name

trans-unit.source: the name of the service shown in <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: the name of the service shown in <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>

trans-unit.source: Description

seg-source.mrk: Description

trans-unit.source: a description which will help you to recognize the service

seg-source.mrk: a description which will help you to recognize the service

trans-unit.source: Startup type

seg-source.mrk: Startup type

trans-unit.source: choose if the service shall start automatically on startup or if you want to start it manually

seg-source.mrk: choose if the service shall start automatically on startup or if you want to start it manually

trans-unit.source: Fill in any other service configuration settings you deem appropriate for your system in the other tabs.

seg-source.mrk: Fill in any other service configuration settings you deem appropriate for your system in the other tabs.

trans-unit.source: Click on Install service .

seg-source.mrk: Click on Install service .

trans-unit.source: Now you can start the script engine with the following command:

seg-source.mrk: Now you can start the script engine with the following command:

seg-source.mrk: You can check the status of the script engine by executing:

trans-unit.source: In order to stop the script engine again, execute the following command:

seg-source.mrk: In order to stop the script engine again, execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: While it is running, you can open your browser and go to the URL you have configured for the script engine, by default this <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>. If the engine is running, you will see a blank page with this content: <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">{}</kbd>

seg-source.mrk: While it is running, you can open your browser and go to the URL you have configured for the script engine, by default this <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">http://localhost:8081</kbd>.
If the engine is running, you will see a blank page with this content: <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">{}</kbd>

trans-unit.source: Besides using <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">nssm</kbd> on the command line, you will find a new service when you open the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>. The script engine will show up under the name you configured as display name. You can start and stop the script engine from here as well.

seg-source.mrk: Besides using <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">nssm</kbd> on the command line, you will find a new service when you open the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">services.msc</kbd>.
The script engine will show up under the name you configured as display name.
You can start and stop the script engine from here as well.

trans-unit.source: Linux

seg-source.mrk: Linux

trans-unit.source: On Linux this task is usually accomplished with Init scripts using the respective Init system of your Linux distribution. Because there are several different Init systems, Signavio will not provide a template. However, if you don't already have a template, you can find lots of matching templates for your Init system on the internet.

seg-source.mrk: On Linux this task is usually accomplished with Init scripts using the respective Init system of your Linux distribution.
Because there are several different Init systems, Signavio will not provide a template.
However, if you don't already have a template, you can find lots of matching templates for your Init system on the internet.

trans-unit.source:
As mentioned before, the script engine can be started from within $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME by executing: 
node server.js
You have to ensure your Init script starts the Node.js executable node and uses the JavaScript file $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/server.js as an argument. Note, if you use a restricted user to execute the command, make sure the user has appropriate access to the $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME directory.

seg-source.mrk:
As mentioned before, the script engine can be started from within $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME by executing: 
node server.js
You have to ensure your Init script starts the Node.js executable node and uses the JavaScript file $SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME/server.js as an argument.
Note, if you use a restricted user to execute the command, make sure the user has appropriate access to the <kbd xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">$SCRIPT_ENGINE_HOME</kbd> directory.
